entry.title: Man arrested for allegedly choking and threatening a woman
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 11:05 a.m. A 50-year-old Roseburg man was arrested Sunday evening for felony strangulation and other charges. Royce Morgan allegedly choked a woman and caused injuries to her throat and neck, according to Roseburg Police. He also reportedly told the woman she was going to die and he would “leave her body in...

entry.title: 41-year-old cited for allegedly fighting at Mercy
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 11:05 a.m. Roseburg Police arrested a 41-year-old Roseburg man on harassment charges after he allegedly punched a man in the Mercy Medical Center parking lot Sunday. The two men were reportedly arguing around 7:30 p.m. when the 41-year-old hit the other man in the face. RPD said there were no injuries reported...

entry.title: Roseburg man arrested after alleged altercation over a fake ID
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 11:00 a.m. A 20-year-old Roseburg man was taken into custody by Roseburg Police late Saturday after he allegedly caused a disturbance at a business in the 1600 block of O’Dell Avenue. Roseburg Police reported that the man had a fake ID confiscated by an employee at the business. He allegedly grabbed a...

entry.title: Roseburg man arrested on felony assault charges
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 10:55 a.m. Roseburg Police arrested Justin Jones on felony assault charges early Saturday morning after he allegedly admitted to kicking a woman in the ribs. According to the RPD report, officers received a report that Jones had gotten into a physical altercation with a woman. Roseburg Police said the victim claimed she...

entry.title: Roseburg man arrested again for trespassing
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 10:50 a.m. A Roseburg man was arrested on trespass charges Saturday afternoon at a motel in the 3100 block of Northwest Aviation Drive in Roseburg. The 49-year-old allegedly locked himself inside one of the motel’s rooms. Roseburg Police were able to remove the man, who was taken into custody and lodged at...

entry.title: RPD makes multiple DUII stops over the weekend
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 10:45 a.m. Roseburg Police cited three individuals for driving under the influence of intoxicants between Friday and early Monday morning. Officers stopped a 53-year-old Roseburg woman on Friday just before midnight. RPD said the woman was visibly impaired and refused to perform a field sobriety test. She was taken into custody and...

entry.title: RHS marching band takes first at regional competition
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 6:45 a.m. The Roseburg High School Marching Band placed first out of 13 bands at a regional competition at Liberty High School over the weekend. Roseburg scored well across multiple categories, securing 1st place in Music Effect, General Effect, and Ensemble Visual. The band also earned 2nd place in Visual Effect, Ensemble...

entry.title: Roseburg Library announces fall youth programs
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 6:45 a.m. The Roseburg Public Library announced its fall youth program that will begin in October. Youth Services Librarian Aurora Ropp will host “Storytime with Aurora,” a mainstay at the library. The program is held weekly at 10:15 a.m. every Wednesday and Thursday, beginning Wednesday. Storytime is geared towards kids aged 2...

entry.title: Missing elderly woman found dead near residence
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 6:30 a.m. A 90-year-old Riddle woman was found dead near her residence after being reported missing Saturday afternoon. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office announced that Shirley Hart had left her residence overnight Friday and had been reported missing. Hart suffered from dementia and was considered to be at risk. Deputies, Search and...

entry.title: Tiller teen located safely Sunday
entry.summary: Sept. 29, 2025 6:30 a.m. A Tiller teenager was found and reunited safely with her family Sunday, according to the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office. Kayleigh Ann Prukop was initially reported missing on Friday night. DCSO said the 18-year-old had left her residence around 2 p.m. and was thought to be headed towards a friend’s house....

entry.title: Roseburg Forest Products lays off 107 employees, closes Dillard Hardwood Plywood plant
entry.summary: The "Timber Capitol of the World" was just hit by a major blow. One of the area’s major employers, Roseburg Forest Products laid off more than 100 employees last Thursday after closing one of its Dillard plants.

entry.title: Reedsport hosts ribbon-cutting ceremony for new tiki room
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:25 a.m. The City of Reedsport is hosting a ribbon-cutting ceremony at the Hoaloha Tiki Room grand opening celebrations Saturday. Mayor Linda McCollum and City Manager Deanna Schafer will be on hand for the event. The event is scheduled from 5-6 p.m. It’s free and open to the public. Hoaloha Tiki Room...

entry.title: Roseburg Forest Products announces end of Hardwood Plywood Plant operations
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:25 a.m. Roseburg Forest Products has closed operations at its Dillard Hardwood Plywood facility and will exit the hardwood plywood market, the company announced Thursday. The Douglas County based lumber company said in a release that the decision was made to reflect the long-term plan for Roseburg Forest Products to concentrate resources...

entry.title: UNF removes public use restrictions
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:22 a.m. The Umpqua National Forest has removed Public Use Restrictions as of Friday morning. Recent rainfall and cooler temperatures have allowed forest management to lift the restrictions and lower the fire danger level to “moderate.” The Industrial Fire Precaution Level will move to level 1 as of 12:01 a.m. Monday. With...

entry.title: “Ghosts of Roseburg” tours offered in October
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:20 a.m. With October and Halloween on the horizon, folks looking for a fright can put a “Ghosts of Roseburg” tour on their calendar. Event organizer Val Gordon said the tours bring to life downtown Roseburg’s dark and colorful spirits. Tour guides will take groups on an approximately 1.5 hour immersive experience...

entry.title: UNF rescinds emergency fire closure order
entry.summary: Sept. 26, 2025 10:15 a.m. The Umpqua National Forest has rescinded an Emergency Fire Closure Order that was impacting a small portion of the Diamond Lake Ranger District due to the Emigrant Fire.
